questions.subject: R/exams/01
questions.question:
A survey with 52 persons was conducted to analyze the design of an advertising campaign. Each respondent was asked to evaluate the overall impression of the advertisement on an eleven-point scale from 0 (bad) to 10 (good). The evaluations are summarized separately with respect to type of occupation of the respondents in the following figure.

To analyze the influence of occupation on the evaluation of the advertisement an analysis of variance was performed:

  Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq     F   Pr(>F)
1     51 34.280                            
2     48 29.609  3     4.671 2.524 0.068681

Which of the following statements are correct?
questionlist: It can be shown that the evaluation of the respondents depends on their occupation. (Significance level 5%)
The fraction of explained variance is larger than 15%.
The fraction of explained variance is smaller than 14%.
The test statistic is smaller than 9.3.
A one-sided alternative was tested for the mean values.
solution: In order to be able to answer the questions the fraction of explained variance has to be determined. The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (RSS0) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (RSS1) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by 1 − RSS1/RSS0 = 1 − 29.609/34.28 = 0.136.
The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.
solutionlist: False. The p value is 0.0687 and hence not significant. It can not be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.
False. The fraction of explained variance is 0.136 and hence not larger than 0.15.
True. The fraction of explained variance is 0.136 and hence smaller than 0.14.
True. The test statistic is F = 2.524 and hence smaller than 9.3.
False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.

questions.subject: R/exams/02
questions.question:
A survey with 50 persons was conducted to analyze the design of an advertising campaign. Each respondent was asked to evaluate the overall impression of the advertisement on an eleven-point scale from 0 (bad) to 10 (good). The evaluations are summarized separately with respect to type of occupation of the respondents in the following figure.

To analyze the influence of occupation on the evaluation of the advertisement an analysis of variance was performed:

  Res.Df    RSS Df Sum of Sq      F     Pr(>F)
1     49 42.027                               
2     46 22.953  3    19.074 12.741 3.4485e-06

Which of the following statements are correct?
questionlist: It can be shown that the evaluation of the respondents depends on their occupation. (Significance level 5%)
The fraction of explained variance is smaller than 54%.
The fraction of explained variance is larger than 59%.
A one-sided alternative was tested for the mean values.
The test statistic is smaller than 24.1.
solution: In order to be able to answer the questions the fraction of explained variance has to be determined. The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (RSS0) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (RSS1) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by 1 − RSS1/RSS0 = 1 − 22.953/42.027 = 0.454.
The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.
solutionlist: True. The p value is 3.45e − 06 and hence significant. It can be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.
True. The fraction of explained variance is 0.454 and hence smaller than 0.54.
False. The fraction of explained variance is 0.454 and hence not larger than 0.59.
False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.
True. The test statistic is F = 12.741 and hence smaller than 24.1.

solutionlist: True. The test statistic is F = 1.387 and hence smaller than 2.5.
False. The p value is 0.258 and hence not significant. It can not be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.
False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.
False. The fraction of explained variance is 0.077 and hence not larger than 0.49.
True. The fraction of explained variance is 0.077 and hence smaller than 0.47.

The residual sum of squares when using only a single overall mean value (RSS0) as well as the residual sum of squares when allowing different mean values given occupation (RSS1) are required. Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by 1 − RSS1/RSS0 = 1 − 30.847/38.366 = 0.196.
The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.
solutionlist: False. The test statistic is F = 3.738 and hence not larger than 5.4.
True. The fraction of explained variance is 0.196 and hence smaller than 0.47.
False. The fraction of explained variance is 0.196 and hence not larger than 0.24.
False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.
True. The p value is 0.0174 and hence significant. It can be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.

questions.question:

Both are given in the RSS column of the ANOVA table. The fraction of explained variance is given by 1 − RSS1/RSS0 = 1 − 12.908/25.976 = 0.503.
The statements above can now be evaluated as right or wrong.
solutionlist: False. An ANOVA always tests the null hypothesis, that all mean values are equal against the alternative hypothesis that they are different.
True. The test statistic is F = 14.849 and hence smaller than 20.6.
False. The fraction of explained variance is 0.503 and hence not smaller than 0.26.
True. The fraction of explained variance is 0.503 and hence larger than 0.43.
True. The p value is 8.11e − 07 and hence significant. It can be shown that the evaluations differ with respect to the occupation of the respondents.
